column4: is there a place to dig up system requirements for running ubuntu (disk space in particular)?
2G min
what package are you trying to apt-get
well I tried openssh-server and gnome-taskbar
??  did you do a server install?
did apt-get install openssh-server  finish?
I didn't do a server install I figured that an ssh daemon is fairly standard affair for any machine.
it won't run, it wants me to run dpkg --configure -a, which gives this bus error "over-current on port 1"
type   ps -ale | grep ssh
do you see sshd
but I mean... I just want to install anything I know how to administer a *nix machine.
using your command is not normal    if you want more background  google will help
I don't want to run it, but ubuntu's base install won't let my run apt-get without running dpkg --configure -a
ok  now your asking a different question
no I'm not I'm asking the same question I have been :)
apt-get update doesnt work at all?
no, the install crashes consistently in the middle of the 2nd stage
??? the install never finished?
no
and there doesn't seem to be a way to restart at the second stage
well  you went from this> pashaw: well I tried openssh-server and gnome-taskbar  to  install failing
nah you just missed some sections
thoreauputic's suggestion is a good idea to try if desktop install keeps failing
